title.value: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges
title.justification: The title captures the main focus of the paper, which is to identify and categorize challenges in deploying DRL systems.
title.quote: Deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning Systems: A Taxonomy of Challenges

extractions.description: This paper proposes an empirical study on Stack Overflow (SO) to understand the challenges practitioners face when deploying Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) systems. By analyzing 357 SO posts, the study identifies DRL deployment as more difficult than other aspects of DRL systems development. The paper further builds a taxonomy of 31 unique challenges across four deployment platforms: server/cloud, mobile/embedded systems, browsers, and game engines.

type.justification: The study involves empirical research using data from Stack Overflow to draw conclusions about DRL deployment challenges.
type.quote: we propose an empirical study on Stack Overflow (SO), the most popular Q&A forum for developers, to uncover and understand the challenges practitioners faced when deploying DRL systems.

name.justification: The paper discusses challenges related specifically to Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL), a sub-field of Deep Learning.
name.quote: Deep reinforcement learning (DRL), leveraging Deep Learning (DL) in reinforcement learning, has shown significant potential in achieving human-level autonomy in a wide range of domains

name.justification: The study's focus is on identifying and understanding challenges in the deployment of Deep Reinforcement Learning systems.
name.quote: Currently, depending on the deployment platform, incremental deployment, automating/optimizing data processing pipelines, and using serving systems for models are popular coping strategies that developers use.

name.justification: The paper mentions this model as one of the frameworks used to build DRL solutions.
name.quote: Frameworks and libraries like Stable Baselines [8], Keras-RL [9], and TensorForce [10] are continually being released to relieve the cost of building DRL solutions from scratch.

name.justification: The paper mentions this model as one of the frameworks used for deploying DRL systems, particularly in cloud environments.
name.quote: This approach offers developers tools and services like TensorFlow Serving [28] or Amazon Sagemaker [29] to accelerate and facilitate deployment.

name.justification: The paper mentions this model as one of the frameworks used for deploying DRL systems on mobile and embedded devices.
name.quote: To cope with limited edge platforms’ resources, lightweight DL frameworks such as TF Lite [30]...are built to reduce the DNN footprint.

name.justification: The paper mentions this model as one of the frameworks used for deploying DRL systems on mobile and embedded devices.
name.quote: These frameworks are also used in DRL to compress the agent’s DNN. To decrease memory cost and processing overhead, TF Lite [30] and Core ML [31] employ model compression strategies.

name.justification: The paper mentions this model as one of the frameworks used for deploying DRL systems in game engines like Unity3D.
name.quote: Popular game engines, such as Unity3d, provide neural network inference packages (e.g., Barracuda [36]) that enable the usage of DRL agents within games.

name.justification: The paper mentions ONNX in the context of model conversion challenges for DRL deployment.
name.quote: Model Conversion. It includes issues associated with any setting misbehavior or incorrect use of model conversion frameworks (e.g., ONNX) [66].

name.justification: The paper uses this dataset as the primary source of data for the empirical study.
name.quote: We download the SO dump from the official Stack Exchange Data Dump [37] on the 11th of October 2022.

name.justification: The paper mentions this library as one of the tools used for deploying DRL systems on browsers.
name.quote: For browser deployment, developers employ particular frameworks and libraries for adapting DRL agents, such as TensorFlow.js and brain.js.

name.quote: For browser deployment, developers employ particular frameworks and libraries for adapting DRL agents, such as TensorFlow.js and brain.js.

name.justification: The paper uses this library in the context of browser-based deployment of DRL systems.
name.quote: To further complement D, we extract SO questions having a DRL vocabulary word within their title or body and tagged with tensorflow.js, brain.js, and ml5.js.

name.justification: The paper mentions this library as one of the popular DL frameworks used to build DRL-based systems.
name.quote: Since many practitioners are still using classical DL frameworks such as Pytorch and TensorFlow to build DRL-based systems, we complement A with questions tagged with “Pytorch” or “TensorFlow”...
